definition: root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: And he has discovered many such grass-roots experts on douban. com.
sentences.chinese: 而且他在豆瓣网上已经找到了许多这样的草根专家。

sentences.english: Cattle can damage forage crops by eating down to the roots.
sentences.chinese: 牛会把草根吃掉，这样会损害饲料作物。

sentences.english: They – in fact, it was a grassroots movement.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些人的行动，是一场草根式的行动。

sentences.english: Although immensely ambitious, he would never lose touch with his plebeian roots.
sentences.chinese: 尽管拥有雄心壮志，但他从来没有丢失他的草根气节。

sentences.english: In doing so, they’ve demonstrated fantastic principles for grassroots-based cause efforts.
sentences.chinese: 通过这种方式，它们证明了草根公益事业的独特原则。

sentences.english: The African Elephant eat grass roots, tree barks, leaved branches and fruits.
sentences.chinese: 非洲象吃草根，树皮，带叶的树枝和果实。

sentences.english: Second, these efforts must reach deeper to the grassroots.
sentences.chinese: 第二，这些努力必须深入到基层草根阶层。

sentences.english: Looks like grass, smells minty and taste similar to lemon.
sentences.chinese: 外貌像草根，冰爽的味道与柠檬的口感。

sentences.english: Remove all organic material, including roots, when preparing the sub-grade.
sentences.chinese: 在准备地基时要去除全部有机物质，包括树根草根。

sentences.english: The color of soap from Gromwell Root Infused Oil.
sentences.chinese: 皂的颜色效果来自紫草根浸泡油。

sentences.english: The preparation of the grass root gala has experienced a lot of challenges since its inception.
sentences.chinese: 草根春晚从筹办开始就经历了一系列的挑战。

sentences.english: Thereinto, the grass-roots voluntary organizations have begun the fore.
sentences.chinese: 其中，草根志愿组织也已开始崭露头角。

sentences.english: Apple mania has even inspired grass-roots inventors.
sentences.chinese: 对苹果的痴狂也激发了草根发明者的灵感。

sentences.english: "The Grass-Rooted Culture" is a wide-spread culture.
sentences.chinese: “草根文化”是广泛传播的文化。

sentences.english: All along of rich guest content has careless root sex, it is UGC .
sentences.chinese: 博客内容向来是具有草根性的，是UGC。

sentences.english: There are no good options here, and a grass-roots revolution is almost impossible.
sentences.chinese: 在朝鲜没有更好的选择，草根革命几乎是不可能的。

definition: marginalized people (not part of mainstream society)/marginal man (term coined by social psychologist Kurt Lewin, referring to a person in transition between two cultures or social groups, not fully belonging to either)
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
to be born of/to come from/family background/class origin
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
cutting-edge (in technology, science, fashion, the arts etc)/novel and competitive/new and dashing
in one's spare time/outside working hours/amateur (historian etc)
to go through challenging experiences/to become seasoned (in one's profession etc)
